APPEALS.Defintion: a request made to a court of law or to someone in authority to change a previous decision

ARISTOCRATIC.Defintion: a class of people who hold high social rank

BRANCHED OUT.Defintion: to start to do something different from what you usually do, especially in your job

CATERING.Defintion: providing what is wanted or needed by someone or something

CONNOTATIONS.Defintion: a feeling or idea that is suggested by a particular word although it need not be a part of the word's meaning, or something suggested by an object or situation

CONSPIRED.Defintion: to plan secretly with other people to do something bad, illegal, or against someone's wishes

CONTROVERSIES.Defintion: a lot of disagreement or argument about something, usually because it affects or is important to many people

DEEP POCKETS.Defintion: (idiom) If an organisation or person has deep pockets, they have a lot of money

DEPORTED.Defintion: to force someone to leave a country, especially someone who has no legal right to be there or who has broken the law

DISREPUTABLE.Defintion: not trusted or respected; thought to have a bad character

DRAGGED.Defintion: brought into (usually against that person or thing's will)

EMPHASIS.Defintion: the particular importance or attention that is given to something

ENOUGH WAS ENOUGH.Defintion: something you say when you want something to stop

ERA.Defintion: a period of time of which particular events or stages of development are typical

FATE.Defintion: what happens to a particular person or thing, especially something final or negative, such as death or defeat

FULFILL.Defintion: to do something that is expected, hoped for, or promised, or to cause it to happen

FULFILLED.Defintion: to do something that is expected, hoped for, or promised, or to cause it to happen

GAMBLE.Defintion: to do something that involves risks that might result in loss of money or failure, hoping to get money or achieve success

HEFTY.Defintion: large in amount, size, force, etc.

HONOURED.Defintion: To honour a promise or agreement is to do what you said you would

HOODIE.Defintion: a sweatshirt (= cotton clothing for the upperbody) that has a hood to cover the head

HUMBLE.Defintion: poor or of a low social rank

INSTALLED.Defintion: to put furniture, a machine, or a piece of equipment into position and make it ready to use

INSTITUTION.Defintion: a custom or tradition that has existed for a long time and is accepted as an important part of a particular society

INTRINSICALLY.Defintion: in a way that is an extremely important and basic characteristic of a person or thing

LARGER THAN LIFE.Defintion: If someone is larger than life, that person attracts a lot of attention because they are more exciting or interesting than most people

LAVISH.Defintion: large in quantity and expensive or impressive

LAWSUIT.Defintion: a problem taken to a law court by an ordinary person or an organisation rather than the police in order to obtain a legal decision

LOGO.Defintion: a design or symbol used by a company to advertise its products

MONEY LAUNDERING.Defintion: the crime of moving money that has been obtained illegally through banks and other businesses to make it seem as if the money has been obtained legally

MOTTO.Defintion: a short sentence or phrase that expresses a belief or purpose

MOURNING.Defintion: to feel or express great sadness, especially because of someone's death

NOVELTY.Defintion: the quality of being new and unusual

OPAQUE.Defintion: difficult to understand or know about, especially because things have been intentionally kept secret or made complicated

PARACHUTES.Defintion: a piece of equipment made of a large piece of special cloth that is fastened to a person or thing that is dropped from an aircraft, in order to make him, her, or it fall slowly and safely to the ground

PETITIONED.Defintion: a document signed by a large number of people demanding or asking for some action from the government or another authority

PLAIN SAILING.Defintion: to be easy and without problems

PLAYGROUND.Defintion: an area designed for children to play in outside, especially at a school or in a park

PRICE TAGS.Defintion: a piece of paper with a price that is attached to a product, or the amount that something costs

PUT YOURSELF IN THE SHOES.Defintion: to imagine that you are someone in a difficult situation, and imagine how that person feels

RATIONALE.Defintion: the reasons or intentions that cause a particular set of beliefs or actions

SATIRICAL.Defintion: a way of criticising people or ideas in a humorous way, especially in order to make a political point, or a piece of writing that uses this style

SCANDAL.Defintion: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

SKY HIGH.Defintion: Sky-high prices or charges are very high

SLOGAN.Defintion: a short easily remembered phrase, especially one used to advertise an idea or a product

SPECULATIVE.Defintion: based on a guess and not on information

SURREAL.Defintion: strange; not seeming real; like a dream

SWIFTLY.Defintion: happening or moving quickly or within a short time, especially in a smooth and easy way

TAKE FOR GRANTED.Defintion: If you take situations or people for granted, you do not realise or show that you are grateful for how much you get from them

TELLING.Defintion: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks

TRAJECTORY.Defintion: the curved path that an object follows after it has been thrown or shot into the air

TRAUMATISED.Defintion: severely shocked and upset in a way that causes lasting emotional pain

UPMARKET.Defintion: Upmarket goods and products are of very high quality and intended to be bought by people who are quite rich

WAGED A PERSONAL WAR.Defintion: to fight a (personal) war or organise a series of activities in order to achieve something
